intro: Aulacospermum multifidum, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that split into multiple lobes, giving it a star-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by dry, capsule-like fruits. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study in xerophytic ecosystems.
